Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class CharacterCard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.CharacterCard
Direct Known Subclasses:
Character1, Character10, Character11, Character12, Character3, Character5, Character7, Character9, CharacterWithoutInput
public abstract class CharacterCard extends Object
Abstract class CharacterCard provides all the behaviour that are common to all characters in the game.

  • Method Details

    • getPrice

      public int getPrice()
      Returns the coin price that a player have to pay in order to play the character
      Returns:
      the character coin price

    • isCoinPresent

      public boolean isCoinPresent()
      Checks if someone has already played this character during the game (the first player that plays the character have to put a coin on the character, so the coin price is incremented by one)
      Returns:
      true if the coin is present, otherwise false

    • putCoin

      public void putCoin()
      Puts a coin in the character card, this can happen only the first time the character is played

    • playCard

      public void playCard(Player player) throws NotEnoughCoinsException
      Method playCard set the current player that want to play this character (if he has enough coins) and puts a coin in the character if it isn't present. This method provides a default implementation that is valid for many character, but not fall all characters (these have to override it).
      Parameters:
      player - the player who wants to play the character
      Throws:
      NotEnoughCoinsException - if the player doesn't have enough coins to play the character

    • useEffect

      public abstract void useEffect(Map<String,Object> arguments) throws IllegalCharacterActionRequestedException
      Method useEffect provides a way on which a player can use the character effect during the turn after the time he has played the character (only for characters that have some inputs). The specified arguments represent an encoding of the parameters that a character card needs to perform his action. The CharacterController will make sure that all the arguments that are passed to the character
      Parameters:
      arguments - the character parameters
      Throws:
      IllegalCharacterActionRequestedException - if the parameters are not correct, or if the character does not provide any effect that can be used after the player plays the card

    • getPlayerActive

      public Player getPlayerActive()
      Returns the last player that has played this character (even if he has already terminated his turn)
      Returns:
      the last player that has played the character

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Returns the character card id
      Returns:
      the character card id

    • addListener

      public void addListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Binds the specified PropertyChangeListener to a character card
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener (a CharacterListener)
      See Also:
      • CharacterListener

    • firePropertyChange

      public void firePropertyChange(PropertyChangeEvent evt)
      Fire a property change event
      Parameters:
      evt - the event that is fired

    • requiresInput

      public boolean requiresInput()
      Returns true if the character requires an input to be played, otherwise false.
      Returns:
      true if the character requires an input to be played, otherwise false.

    • restoreCharacter

      public abstract void restoreCharacter(Game game)
      Restore the character after the game was restored from persistence data
      Parameters:
      game - the restored game

    • restoreActivePlayer

      public void restoreActivePlayer(Player player)
      Restore the active player of the character after the game was restored from persistence data
      Parameters:
      player - the active player of the character
